intro: Acourtia rigida, commonly known as the rigid acourtia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, rigid leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and yellow, often appearing in clusters, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Acourtia rigida is a perennial herb that is often found in coastal and inland desert regions.
